39150262.review:
[b]A "hardcore minimal arcade game" as the Steam Store page says.[/b] I don't know how to pronounce the name.

The only controls are the spacebar and LMB, but they both do the same thing so it's just up to preference on which you want to use.
There's no real resolution support for the game. The only good way to play is on fullscreen because using ALT + ENTER makes the window the same resolution as your set native resolution.

The game's as minimal as it's stated. The premise for the entirety of the game is just to move a dot from one circle to another without the dot running into anything. You do this until you reach the last circle that clears the level. Being arcade-y, it's also a short game with only 8 levels, but 4 of those levels are just psychidelically higher difficulty versions of the other 4, so really there's only actually 4 levels, and all these can be finished quick if you're good. 
There's an "Endless mode" but that's really all it is, an endless version of the game that you can try to get a better score at.

Watching any video of this game, especially the ones on the store page here, will tell you exactly what the game is like.
It's small in file size, cheap in price, short, pretty fun, and a little tough.

37946751.review:
Recommended with a grain of salt. The levels are well-designed and require a lot of precision timing, especially towards the end. The endless mode gets challenging really quickly.
But if you've ever played a rhythm game or are even vaguely aware of the rhythm in electronic music, I highly recommend you mute it. Don't get me wrong, the music isn't bad, and it fits the art style. But it is almost never in sync with the rhythm that many sections of the game demand - it will tend to throw your timing off where you need it most.
Also, I had problems with collision detection on the last section of a level which made it (more) impossible to complete, but thankfully after restarting the game I was able to continue from the same save point and it was working again.

37751176.review:
On the one hand its a great game. On the other it might be consider some form of illegal torture...

More genuinely, Id be tempted to give it a neutral if the option existed because this gets pretty ludicrously tough. The first two levels are difficult, the wobbly modes certainly ramp that up, but then you get to the third and realise that they were practically tutorials.

The third level just keeps going on, and on, its much longer, much much tougher and about half way through had the 9 rings, 9 leaps in a row you have to get perfect, no space for rest, you cant even repeat a ring, as you die if you miss it the first time round. The timing for each ring is slightly different, each ring is done in less than a second, and most require additional jumps to dodge spikes. That one section not only cost me more lives than the first two levels combined, it cost me about ten fold the lives of the first two levels combined. It was beyond what was physically possible for me to react to, I ended up memorising the timings to the point where I was just tapping out a rhythm without even really responding directly to whats on screen. I ended up finishing level 3 on about 1000 lives lost... 
Ive not yet finished the fourth level.

Obviously something about this keeps me engaged to have such stupid levels of persistence, but it does tread a very fine line between seriously challenging, and essentially impossible for an average player to accomplish without blind luck.

Long story short, good game, worth the cost, but makes super hexagon feel effortless by comparison.

33656561.review:
It's a genuinely fun game, but it runs poorly. It seems to render entirely by CPU, so even good rigs will get a sub-60 framerate. This causes rubberbanding, where everything in the game will slow down and speed up, which kind of ruins a game about precise timing. You'll clip through spikes that were supposed to kill you, and you'll miss jumps that were timed correctly. 

The concept and levels are really good, so don't the thumbs down as a sign that it's a bad game. I just wish I could play it properly. This is exactly the kind of game I'd love, but the performance issues are too severe to be playable.

宣传片已经展现了游戏的全部内容，共四关+无尽，且各自有相对应的扭曲化关卡。最后一个成就是无尽模式100分（跳100次），对不擅长此类游戏的玩家有一定难度。游戏设计思路很棒，极简的风格很赞，音乐和背景都做的很不错。[spoiler]然而音乐与游戏节奏无关，这并不是个音游，且BGM非常单一[/spoiler]
[strike]讲道理的话这游戏很消耗鼠标，不建议使用高端鼠标游戏[/strike]
其实这就是个背板的游戏，即使操作很烂，前四关依靠背板也不怎么会卡关。而无尽模式也是八个左右一循环，情况也只有那么几种，记住了就简单多了。无尽模式的难度很大程度上来源于画面整体的旋转，70分左右时旋转速度就已经非常夸张了。
毕竟这游戏只要几块钱，买不了吃亏买不了上当，推荐。

29404526.review:
A tough-as-nails, no-nonsense challenge in the same vein as Super Hexagon.  Only one button, but the game requires hair-trigger timing.  It comes down to finding a rhythm for each section.

There are only 4 levels (plus endless mode and drunk mode), but each is fiendishly difficult and brilliantly designed.  The levels are impossibly long, but you don't have to complete them in one shot; the game saves your progress at each checkpoint even if you exit the game.  (I wish I had known this before attempting level 3.  I did it in one sitting because I was afraid I'd lose my precious progress if I took a break!)

Apart from one little detail, nothing is unfair.  It's all about finding a rhythm of button-pressing.

This is a wonderful challenge, so why aren't more people talking about it?  Well, oO is a game about watching a circle spinning around and around inside other circles, which may also be spinning and may contain objects rotating in the opposite direction to your spinning!  It can cause hypnosis and nausea if you stare at it too long.

That little unfair detail: the tiny circles.  You spin so fast inside them it's impossible to see when to push the button to flip into the next circle, meaning it comes down to luck.  Not impossible, but frustrating, and there aren't too many of those moments to break the deal for me.

Highly recommended for those who want something to challenge their reflexes.

29372098.review:
oO seems like a really easily game that won't last, but it is much more. It may be only a dot, circles, and spikes but a lot of complexity was put into making this. You're just a dot going through circles, trying to get to the end and escape. However, spikes come in your way along your way as you try to not die by missing the entry to another circle. Through four levels, this changes up, causing you to not only rely on how fast you can go but how you analyze the situation. Is it now or the next rotation that allows you to safely get past spikes? 

oO can be frusturating at times, but trial and error becomes key towards the later levels. A death count is constantly up, beign a score that you can try to lower as you gain experience with the game. Want a more difficult level? Or just bored of seeing the same circles over and over? An extra "drunk" level comes with each level, not needed to complete the game but if the player wants to. With an addition of an endless mode, oO can last for a long time. 

I appreciate how the developer didn't make achievements for not dying in each level. Normally this would be the case, but it's great seeing a game without this asthe levels are truely hard to beat without dying. For the low price it is now, I highly recommend oO.

25480177.review:
This is a pretty interesting game and at the start it is actually a lot of fun. However it quickly turns into remembering patterns and perfect timing. I also feel like there are too little checkpoints. It happens too often that I try to get through a part but it just won't happen, then I finally get through it only to die a few seconds later without ever seeing a checkpoint.

And then there is the input lag. This game is all about perfect timing. Got you timing 1% off? Too bad, try again. The problem is that there is a small amount of input lag (very small amount, that usually won't be noticable), which is really bad in this type of game.

Pros:
Good visuals
Decent soundtrack

Neutral:
Interesting game mechanics at first, but turns into frustration later

Cons:
Very frustrating
Input lag

Overall I wouldn't recommend this game (not even for this price) because of the frustration and the input lag.

24839485.review:
Too frustrating to be much fun. I do like the deceptively-simple concept and the wobbly-screen mode you can unlock each time you clear a level... but the overall charm wears off very quickly. It doesn't take long for things to start to feel mindless, and this is not the kind of game where mindless gameplay will get you anywhere.

I'm surprised at the glowing reviews this game has gotten. (And of course anyone who doesn't recommend the game gets slammed with downvotes, I'm sure I'll be no different.) Scrolling through the positive reviews, hardly any of the users seem to have played for more than a couple hours - probably because the ragequit is strong with this one; I imagine many of these people played it once and haven't touched it since - so again, it's tough to understand the positive feedback. For the novelty, sure. Everything else... hm.

Anyways - for the price, if you really want to check it out, I would say that it's worth it. There are very few games I wouldn't pay a dollar for. It's an experience, at least, and I'm not saying it's a bad game; just that I don't personally recommend going out your way for it.

[h1]TL;DR![/h1] 
If you're on the fence and clinging to your last precious dollar, then I would say just pass on this one [u]unless[/u]:
-You have exceptional reflexes
-You don't mind trial and error and error and error and trial and error
-You want achievement bragging rights, or whatever
-You like games with checkpoints that taunt the shit out of you
-You don't want hand-holding, you want a game that hates you
-You checked out the free version on kongregate and want moar

24561266.review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
oO has been developed and published by Maciej Targoni and Wojciech Wasiak. A seemingly simple game, yet it holds plenty of flexibility if not novelty from the arcade formula we’ve seen countless times already. The fact that it was created by a two-man team which has experience already with geometry-based gameplay mechanics, speaks volumes and assures that oO is more than just a shy debut onto Steam’s ever growing indie library.
 
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
While it may not necessarily impress with its looks, oO’s gameplay is most certainly its main attraction. Relatively short and few levels, that are well diversified through careful use of colors and obstacle shapes but quite difficult. Not entirely unexpected since the game has to stand out somehow. I never found it frustratingly hard but it does take some hefty time getting used to it. It uses the mouse controls to its advantage and can also provide a test for your own reaction time. For being a fast-paced game, it is surprisingly needy, when it comes to your required level of concentration. I consider it a nice break from other genres and as far as an affordable arcade game is concerned, this title hits all the right spots.
 
The minimal chromatic and shaping style suits the game just fine and the relaxing selection of sounds, prevents a potential attempt at rage quitting. It works as intended and you can’t complain about it at any given point.
 
[h1]Pros[/h1]
+ Fun and challenging for the right price
+ Steam Achievements
 
[h1]Cons[/h1]
- No Trading Cards
 
 
[h1]Result / Final thoughts[/h1]
oO is one of those nice little games on Steam that was appropriately priced from the get-go. It features Achievements, but the inclusion of Trading Cards would have added even more sugar to this sweet deal. Does it really need more sugar to warrant a purchase? Most certainly not.
 
[b]Rating 7/10[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/elitegives]Elite Giveaways[/url], check us out for more reviews ranging from Indie games to AAA titles.[/quote]

22476870.review:
OoOoOoOoOoOoOoOoOoOOooooOooOOOoOOoooOo

Oo est un jeu de reflexe, ou plutot de rythme. Vous incarnez une petite boule blanche qui doit se rendre d'un point A à un point B en parcourant des cercles collés les uns aux autres tels des engrenages. 

Bien entendu ce serait trop simple et sans saveurs si le jeu se resumait à ça. Les fameux cercles seront donc, au fur et à mesure de voitre avancée, parsemés de pics immobiles ... ou non ! A vous de passer de l'exterieur à l'interieur des cercles, et vice versa, afin de les eviter. 
Bien sur c'est le type de jeu ou l'on meurt encore et encore, mais les niveaux n'etants pas aleatoires, vous allez petit à petit, apprendre les pieges et les parcours d'une maniere plutot machinale et rythmique (ceci vous obligeant à ne pas vous contenter d'avoir des reflexes, mais aussi de la mémoire et un sens du rythme de plus en plus rapide) 

Je peux avouer que le dernier niveau à été terminé plus par chance qu'autre chose... je ne sais pas encore comment j'ai reussis ... mais bon, j'ai eu une bonne étoile ! 

Un petit Must vraiment pas cher pour ceux qui aiment les petits try hard (celui ci est vraiment pas mal)

OooOOooOooOooOOOOoOOoOoOoOoOoO

21983730.review:
円の内側と外側を移動しながら障害物を避けてゴールを目指すシンプルなゲーム。プレイムービーを見てもらえば大体どんなゲームか分かるはず。
難易度はかなり高く、死んで覚えるタイプのゲーム。
良かった点としては、こまめにチェックポイントが用意されており、死んでも通過したチェックポイントからすぐにやり直せること。これのおかげで死んでもイライラせずにプレイすることができた。
逆に悪かった点は、ステージが少ないこと。98円のゲームなので少なくて当然だが、もう少し増やしてもらいたかった。あと、円から円に移るときの判定が少しシビアに感じた。判定はもう少し甘くても良いのではないか？
個人的には暇つぶしに最適なゲームだと思う。チェックポイントを通過すればゲームを終了しても、チェックポイントから再開出来るので空いた時間などを使って少しずつ攻略できるし、頑張ってプレイし続ければどのステージもクリア出来る。細かい不満もあるが、98円と安いので気になったら買って損はしないと思う。

Хардкор. Только хардкор. Нужно просто из одной О в другое О перейти в точке соприкосновения. Но скаждым новым О сложность растет. Появляются препятствия, скорость, размер и прочее. Гдето на половине первого уровня я уже начал задумываться - где же этот конец. Но после первого уровня(222 смерти) я понял что первый это были просто цветочки. Во втором все плывет и наше "О" меняет свои граници в хаотическом порядке. И я понимаю что игра будет просто мегахардкорной. Я думаю или мышь полетит в стену к концу игры, или как минимум надо будет ее чистить-ремонтировать после ритмических нажиманий. Я не зря упомянул про ритмичность, порой уже рефлекторно запоминаешь когда нужно нажать, чтобы перейти, и так по накатанной, слава богу в игре есть небольшие чекпоинты.
  Еще в игре есть бессконечный режим. Вот там должен быть просто ад. Но я до него еще не докликал.
Рекомендую любителям Хардкора.

21624401.review:
oO is a fun little game totally worth the 99 cents.

All you have to do is to lead a small white sphere from a ball to another while avoiding spikes. First stage is quite easy but at later levels things such as moving spikes and timed spikes (they disappear and reappear in a certain pattern).

After beating a level you can try a twisted version of it where everything is wobbly and non-circular.

Endless mode is quite fun and is randomized every try. You can get a super lucky run and easily get 100 points or you can get a super hard run and have trouble getting 6 points.

Oh, and fourth level will destroy you.

小丽想找一个稳重有耐心的男朋友，因为她知道自己脾气不好不太好，没耐心，时不时会小作一下，一般的男孩子都受不了。谈了几个男生都因为这些问题没多久就分手了。于是她便来找智慧与光的化身谛听哥哥，请教他该怎么办。
“让他来玩《Oo》吧！玩不了《Oo》的男人，你也用不着和他Xx！”
于是在谛听哥哥的帮chuan助jiao下，小丽成为了斯婷姆的荣誉会员。每当认识一个新男孩的时候，都会推荐他来玩一下《Oo》，看看这个男生能否理解包容自己。
有一个男生外表温文尔雅，某日小丽让他玩《Oo》，结果一关还未结束，这个男生就开始破口大骂，表情抽搐，差点把小丽的电脑给砸了。小丽实在看不下去说别玩了，该男生就才摸了摸已经竖起来的头发，恢复平静的表情说。“宝贝，我们去吃饭好不好。”

接连几次下来，小丽很沮丧。又来找热情与爱的化身谛听哥哥。
谛听看着泫然欲泣的小丽，摸了摸她的脑袋说：
“别灰心，你肯定能找到一个包容你理解你，懂你的男孩子的的。”然后他若无其事地说：
“小丽你看我《Oo》已经全成就了唉。”

21078024.review:
oO - это хардкорная минималистичная игра, в которой нам предстоит играть за белый шарик. Мы должны просто-напросто вращаться внутри или снаружи круга, попутно уворачиваясь от препятствий. Как всё просто звучит, правда?

Плюсы :
+ Минималистичная графика, в которой нет ничего лишнего.
+ Плюс за хардкорность. Первые три основные уровня относительно лёгкие, а вот четвёртый даст пропотеться даже заядлому хардкорщику!
+ Залипательный геймплей. Из игры не хочется выходить, но я вынужден был выходить, чтобы не разъ*бать дорогую клавиатуру :)
+ Скромное музыкальное сопровождение, которое вносит в игру свою изюминку.

Минусы :
- Мне не понравилось отсутствие сюжета или хотя бы какого-то наставления от разработчиков. Хотелось какую-нибудь анимацию в конце игры или слова "Ты сделал это, парень!". Но, к сожалению, такого не было.

Оценка: 7,0/10

P.S. любителям хардкорчика рекомендуется!)

21076704.review:
[h1]"Spikes and Circles"[/h1]
Ingenious quick reaction game. You are a dot running in circles and can swap from the inside to the outside border of the circle. That point where two circles touch you can intercept to the next circles. Apparently there are spikes added in higher levels. So the game becomes quite challenging in the end. Especially the endless mode. But that's what I like.

[b][u]Full Review:[/u][/b]

~ [i]Description[/i] ~

oO is a 2D game where you're a ball on the perimeter of a circle, and with a click you switch from either going around the inside of the circle or the outside. This is used to travel between circles and progress through the levels and to avoid spikes on your way.

~ [i]Gamemodes[/i] ~

[list]
[*] 4 levels of increasing difficulty and new obstacles every level.
[*] Endless mode, which gets harder as you go on, and every circle you progress through increases your score by one.
[*] Bonus versions of each level, where everything has a wobbly effect, causing it to look like the ball is speeding up/slowing down, but it's still moving at the same consistent speed as in the normal levels.
[/list]

~ [i]Pros![/i] ~

[list]
[*] I picked up the game for only $0.89 when it was on sale
[*] Good music that didn't get annoying throughout multiple hours of playtime.
[*] Amazing level design and cycles that are easy to understand but hard to master
[*] Very simple controls. Literally one button. (Space bar or Left Click)
[*] When you die, you go back to the most recent checkpoint, and it restarts the cycle at a specific point, which makes the game far less frustrating than it may first seem.
[/list]

~ [i]Meh's...[/i] ~

[list]
[*] I feel like the game scammed me a few times when switching from circle to circle, but that's probably just me trying to find an excuse to say it wasn't me.
[*] When you use the menu button in the upper left corner while in a level, your ball switches sides of the circle before the menu pops up. It's a minor bug but it can screw you over sometimes.
[*] No way to save your progress mid-level, but it doesn't really matter since the levels are somewhat short and can be done pretty quickly if you have practice and you know what you're doing.
[/list]

~ [i]Cons![/i] ~

[list]
[*] There are only four levels, plus the Endless mode, and no level creator/editor, making the game quite short.
[*] The game may trigger motion sickness on the later levels if you're a bit sensitive to it.
[/list]

~ [i]Achievements[/i] ~

There are 6 achievements, one for beating each of the main levels, one for hitting a score of 15 in Endless, and one for hitting a score of 100 in Endless.

It may be due to my lack of experience in the game and/or just sucking at it in general, but hitting a score of 100 in Endless seems practically impossible to me at the moment.

~ [b][i]Conclusion[/i][/b] ~

If you really want the game, you can go ahead and pick it up for the full $3, but I would honestly wait for it to go on sale at least a little before getting it. I picked it up at the end of the Steam Winter Sale for just $0.89 and I'd consider that absolutely worth it.

The game itself is pretty entertaining and also got intense for the last two levels. Easy to pick up, difficult to master.

20729853.review:
In similar vein to games like Super Hexagon, 140, Gauge and Duet, oO is a minimalistic game with simple objectives and simple controls - on the surface. But while things may look easy enough at first glance, the challenge comes in mastering the sparse mechanics you are given to get past whatever sadistic obstacles oO's glowing, circular world cares to throw in your direction.

With ever more complex patterns to overcome and a faster and faster rate of play, the simple "push space to flip" mechanic might only be one button but will eventually build to challenge even the fastest of reflexes. You will die again, and again, and again [spoiler]and again, and again, and again, and again, and again[/spoiler]; but unlike some other punishing titles of similar ilk, the deaths here don't tend to feel cheap. You'll always know why you died, and what you need to do to avoid death next time.

oO has four main levels, with four optional "drunk" levels and two endless modes which are again normal and drunk. Minimalistic, punishing games like this aren't often to everyone's liking, but I'm a huge fan of 'em and always gun for total completion before moving on. I'm currently on the final drunk level and am slowly going insane trying to complete it - but mental stability aside, oO is a fantastic little entry to the "easy to learn, punishing to master" genre, and I hugely recommend it.

So! With all the familiarities out of the way, I guess there's only one question left to ask you:
Are you ready to die?

19181114.review:
So what is oO? That's a good question...
If you're after something easy and relaxing... this AINT it ;)
In oO you play as a little Circle, and you goal is to progress from circle to circle without much trouble initially.
But the further you get, the difficult ramps up and you'll end up needing to memorise certain areas to pass them. (After failing dozens of times at least)
If the original levels aren't enough, there's a variation of each, (I call it drunk mode)
Spikes, high speed movement, memorisation of patters and MORE spikes!
Let's not forget the survival level... Want to take it slow? NOPE! You've got a big scary red wall chasing you, and it only get faster for each checkpoint you hit.

Super fun game, and super cheap too! Highly Recommended for those with quick reflexes!

[h1]Pas le temps[/h1]

🍙🥄 Difficile mais sympa.

Oui si vous cherchez un super-hexagon-like c'est exactement ce qu'il vous faut. Il coûte 1€ et si vous accrochez, il y en a pour quelques heures. Un bémol cependant. N'espérez pas le 100% succès. ____________________________

barème à titre indicatif (c'est un ressenti personnel - sans 🍴🍹 aux évaluations négatives)
🥄 s'il vous plaît juste une cuillière pour goûter
🍙🥄 juste un bol de temps en temps mais pas tous les jours
🍙🍣🥄 rudement bon dans son genre mais... mais !
🍙🍣🍱🥄 miam excellent, manque juste un petit qqchose !
🍙🍣🍱🍹😍 (vous je sais pas mais) jusqu'à l'indigestion
____________________________

[h1]Le temps d'un café[/h1]

*Rage* *rage* *raAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGE* (╯°□°)╯︵ ┻━┻
Si vous êtes en manque de super hexagon, plusieurs possibilités s'offrent à vous. Vous pouvez relancer super hexagon mais il est atrocement difficile. Ou bien vous pouvez essayer velocibox, c'est la même chose mais en 3D vue subjective. Ou alors vous pouvez vous balancer sur pivvot, difficile lui aussi mais plus relaxant. Ou sinon il y a ce jeu !

Ca se joue avec un seul bouton. Soit la barre espace, soit le clic de la souris. Un clic vous pose à l'intérieur, un autre clic à l'extérieur. Et ensuite il y a des cercles. Le but est de passer de l'un à l'autre en gérant les obstacles et changements de rythme. C'est un concentré de rage. Un truc horrible. Heureusement il y a des points de sauvegarde. Pas beaucoup mais bien placés. Et un mode infini sans point de sauvegarde pour les plus fous.

Et à la fin de chaque niveau un sentiment d'accomplissement. Comme pour tous les jeux fous fous de ce genre, faciles à apprendre mais follement difficiles à maîtriser.

17859480.review:
[table][tr][th][h1][b]FR[/b][/h1][/th][th][h1][u]Découverte du jeu[/u] : [/h1][/th][th] V 0.1[/th][/tr][/table]

[table][tr][th][h1][b]Description & Gameplay.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

oO est un jeu facile à prononcer mais pas à finir. 

Le jeu est simple, vous avancez automatiquement le long des lignes de "cercles" et un clic vous fait changer de côté de la ligne. 
Un concept simple, mais c'est à vous de gérer vos déplacements pour avancer et survivre et c'est là que ça se complique.
Différentes tailles, vitesses, des déformations visuelles, des pièges dynamiques... Autant vous prévenir le jeu est un chouilla dur.

Après chaque section dans un niveau, vous avez un point de respawn pour sauvegarder votre progession tout de même, et le jeu est là pour vous rappeller gentiment le nombre de mort que vous avez eu sur chaque niveau.

[table][tr][th][h1][b]Ambiances sonores et graphismes.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

Côté graphique, le jeu en 2d est très coloré, et fluide. Les animations ont un bon rendus, et les musiques/bruitages rendent le tout fort sympathique.
C'est encore une fois simple, mais ça n'enlève rien à la qualité du jeu. 

[table][tr][th][h1][b]Conclusion.[/b][/h1][/th][/tr][/table]

Lorsque je dit que ce jeu est simple d'un point de vue du concept, des graphismes ou de la bande son, ce n'est nullement péjoratif, c'est vraiment pour décrire l'état du jeu.

Le gros intêret du jeu réside en son challenge qui réussira à provoquer [strike]rage et...[/strike], le guerrier qui sommeil en vous pour réussir à progresser !!!

Comme d'habitude, des screens du jeu sont disponibles sur steam et n'hésitez pas à poser vos questions.

17706688.review:
マウスクリックのタイミングだけが全てという、操作の上では単純きわまるゲームだが、少しづつステージのパターンを理解し、上達していく楽しさに、思わず時間を忘れてしまう。いったんクリアしたステージでも、今度は少しでも失敗の回数を減らそうという再挑戦の意欲がわく。ただし、気の短い人や、リズムゲームが極端に苦手な人には向かないかも知れない。とはいえ、この安さだし、とりあえず試しても損はないだろう。

（ここまでで「じゃあ買ってみようか」あるいは「興味ねぇな」と思ったなら、以下は読まなくても結構です）


【ゲームの概要】
様々な大きさの「円」が、円周部分で互いに接した状態で、たくさん連なっている。その円の内側を、一つのドットが一定の速さで回転している。円同士の接点にドットが来た瞬間、タイミングよくマウスクリックすると、隣の円に移動することができる。これを繰り返してゴールまでたどりつけばステージクリアとなる。

なお、円の接点以外の部分でクリックすると、ドットが円の「外側」に移動する（再クリックで戻る）。これは、円に配置された様々なトラップを避けて進むための必須テクニックである。

クリックのタイミングを誤ったり、トラップに衝突すると失敗となり、直前のチェックポイントまで戻される。失敗回数に制限はない。プレイはいつでも中断出来て、前回のチェックポイントから再開可能。

ステージは、大きく2種類に分けられる。

（Ａ）円の配置や大きさ、トラップの位置や種類などが完全に定まっており、それをクリアするのが目的のノーマルステージ（難易度順に４つ）。

（Ｂ）円の移動に1回成功するごとに「次の円」がリアルタイムでランダムに追加されていくサバイバルモード。

さらに、各ステージには、まるで水面に映った風景のように、常にぐにゃぐにゃとステージ全体が歪む効果が付加されたバリエーションも用意されている（トラップや円の配置自体は、ノーマルと同じ）。当然、難易度は上がる。


【蛇足的感想】
一般的なそれとは全く異なる外見だが、このゲームを遊ぶ感覚は、一種の「リズムゲーム」に近いと思う。しかも、一定の拍子ではなく、常に拍子やテンポが変化し続ける「リズムゲーム」。上記の通り、ドットの移動速度自体は一定だが、円の大きさやトラップの周期（＝拍子）が異なれば、当然、移動のタイミングも変化するし、特にトラップ満載のステージでは、「拍子」のパターンを正確に読む（覚える）ことが重要となる。また、円の外側と内側という概念は、「表拍」と「裏拍」に似ている……と、そこまで言ったら、こじつけが過ぎるか。

17688746.review:
I wasn't expecting much out of this game for $1 but I was pleasantly surprised.  It's not the kind of game you think you'll be coming back to, but there is something addictive in it's simplicity and difficulty.

The concept is as simple as the graphics and the music in this game.  Your a circle, moving inside (or outside) of another another circle.  When you click the mouse, you switch which side of the circle you're in.  Use this simple little ability to move from circle to circle and make a path forward.  Then you start to throw in some spikes and obstacles and the game starts to feel a bit more rewarding.  Then you turn that up to 11 and you're screaming expletives at your computer screen and swearing on your mother's grave you will not be defeated by such a simple concept of a game.  It's fun, addicting, and rewarding.  The visuals are nothing impressive and I preferred to turn the sound off and play my own music, but for $1 it's worth your time.

17275762.review:
刚入手，玩了前3关。正在努力尝试第4关。短短一个小时已经死了800次。
这个游戏有毒啊。明明又朴素又枯燥，又难的想让人砸电脑，可就是停不下来。
游戏只有鼠标左键一个操作，通过单击控制小球穿越圆圈的边界，从切点穿越可以进入下一个圆圈。
虽然理论上通过观察就可以预判小球的运动轨迹以及合适的操作时机，但是实际上一旦进入游戏节奏就很难冷静下来去思考。
不过前面4关的图都是固定的，所以可以和其他动作游戏一样背版。
而且有些速度快的地方根本没有机会停下来思考，只能靠不断的尝试去掌握操作的节奏。
每关的扭曲模式其实和普通模式是完全一样的，普通模式的节奏记住了，就可以很容易的通过（虽然我扭曲模式明显要多死好多次）
喜欢鬼畜游戏的抖M肯定会爱上这款游戏的。
第5关还没玩，看介绍视频的话是一命挑战模式，不知道是不是随机的，是不是无限的。

如果你对刺的恐惧仅仅只是来自I wanna，那么只需一小时oO会刷新你对刺的理解。
首先难度不用说绝对是手残党们的克星。
其次游戏一共五种关卡，以及五种关卡的难度[spoiler]恶心度[/spoiler]提升版(笑)，前两关的话以本人的感觉还是比较容易的，然而等你玩到后两关就能够明白自己有多手残了（各种反应跟不上小球和刺的速度），可以说每一次到达存档点都是对心灵的一种解脱，但如果你把存档点当作解脱那就大错特错了，oO的存档点完全可以理解为新的炼獄的开始，仅能容你在圈圈刺刺中喘息。最后的无尽模式，不仅圈和刺是你的敌人，连容你喘息的时间也成为了对手，你只能在这无尽加速的圈圈刺刺中徘徊，等待时间将你吞噬殆尽。

还是推荐不性急的小伙伴来试试这个有趣又不失难度的游戏，只要0.99刀你就能体验抖M的日常(｀・ω・´)

17180815.review:
This game follows the same principle of Geometry Dash, but instead of squares and jumping, you control a small ball rolling along the lines of circles, avoiding stationary, moving and disappearing obstacles.

One major con is the number of levels. About 8 levels, plus a survival mode. And there's no leaderboard to compare your performance with other players'.

There really isn't much more to say of what this game's about, except it's definitly a rage game. You'll end up with a headache and with your blood pressure going through the roof - and possibly with a broken mouse/keyboard - but for what it costs, it's difficult not to recommend this game.

If you're bored and tired of complex games, give this one a try. Warning, though: you'll rage.

17062505.review:
某个基友送我的这款游戏，开始看了看0.99刀，感觉是像大山一样用“心”去玩的游戏（笑~）
然后我看到这游戏只有不到300m，在无聊中打开了这款游戏，然后我感觉这就好比上了贼船，这游戏有毒！！

我自认为自己不是抖m，恩..但这游戏的宗旨就好比o→O的过程，每次打到那种大圈圈有着各种各样的刺的时候我总能自信地说出：我能反杀！！(°∀°)ﾉ    然后就在后面看似简单的无刺小圈上打出了GG(´･_･`)  恩...吓得我差点砸了鼠标。

从某种意义上来说这是个背板的游戏，一路狂奔总会被教做人的，从开始看起来平淡无奇的静止的圆和刺到不停变化的快速的圆和刺，这游戏在一步步把o变成O，还有魔性的背景音乐和扭曲的肥皂泡模式，还有后面节奏越来越快的反人类无尽模式，根本停不下来！！

但是这游戏不推荐手残党和急性子玩，我感觉这对你的电脑并不友好（笑~）就我看来虽然这不是个多耐玩的游戏，而且可能一次次挑战你的忍耐极限，但是0.99刀的价格是绝对不亏的游戏。

17041945.review: 如果我是一个独立开发者，我想，这就是我很愿意开发出来的一款游戏了。没有华丽的画质，光怪陆离的音效，我找不到任何这些所谓被三A级大作惯坏了的玩家所看重的东西。它所拥有的，仅仅是一个圈内圈外的理念，但仅仅就是这个理念，在无数个组合之下，迸发出的灵感确是无穷无尽的，这让游戏最终起到一个四两拨千斤的效果。很多的成功的独立游戏都是这样，像是MC，flappy bird，围绕一个简单的中心延伸出无限的趣味。抛开这点不提，游戏的一些小设定也多少有点意思，比如失败之后陷阱会重置，这样很大程度上减少了难度；又比如选择关卡时，也引用了游戏内容，用一个一个圈代表各个关卡；游戏的名字在玩过以后才会发觉也是一大亮点。当然，oO不是完美的，也存在UI过于朴素甚至简陋，扭曲关卡的扭曲过于程式化等问题，但其瑕不掩瑜，起码玩过之后绝对不会认为1刀打了水漂。

16963335.review:
I just bought this game to write a review as I've played this on my Android a lot so please don't go with my Steam Play hours.

Oo is one of my favorite game as it takes some patience for one to get pass a level. This game never gets boring because there's always some randomness which will keep you entertaining.

I've played this game on my Android and am glad they made one for the PC as well. The concept is pretty simple, you have a ball spinning around in the ring and you need to advance by switching from one ring to another where they get connected from.

It's not just that, each level gets more and more tough as these rings have spikes, they move in a wavy shape, screen angles rotate and some rings will drop in randomly.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Lots and lots of hours of fun
    [*]Difficulty at max
    [*]Unique pattern of gameplay on each level
    [*]Minimal Graphics
    [*]Dude, it's just 1$ game (I seriously seriously want that the developer of this game should sell it for 3$ atleast, I won't mind paying even 5$ for such a game honestly)
[/list]

[b]Cons (Actually none but some suggestions infact)[/b]
[list]
    [*]Level editor missing, will be fun to have one
    [*]Need an endless + random endless mode, not sure if it has one as I've not completed the game on my phone
    [*]Can improve graphics
    [*]Increase the damn price xD
[/list]

Again, great piece of work, thanks for making this game.

HATE! LOVE! Don't like!
Why?

Hate:
It is a hard game that will punish you for any mistake that you make in which you are given all the details of how to die.

Love:
It is a simple idea and runs with it. It makes getting in and out of the game easy enough that if you only had 15 minutes to play a game, it would be fun (and difficult).

Don't like:
All the wavy levels give me motion sickness. It is hard to say that it is an extra bit of challenge when It feels more like a cop out answer. 

All that aside. I still would recommend anyone that is looking for a hard game without the hard price tag.

P.S. It's stink'n hard and I will crush it!

16956636.review:
Tough-as-nails precision games like Super Meat Boy must do several things:

1. They must be difficult. 
2. They must make the player feel like they [i]can[/i] clear each stage/board/level, even if it takes 500 attempts.
3. They must strike a balance between the following reactions: (a) Oh, come on -- I [i]totally]/i] landed one pixel to the left! (b) Oh, I timed that just a little wrong. (c) Oh my god. I can't believe I just did that. My incompetence is hilarious.

Oo strikes this balance perfectly. Reflexes, pattern recognition, and tiny bits of critical thinking all combine to make for a beautifully infuriating experience. The wavy boards are just silly, but I don't think they're required.

The music is decent, although I wish I could turn it down without turning it off. The sound design matches the minimalist visuals elegantly.

Well worth the low price.

16937827.review:
Ich schwanke dieses Mal ordentlich hin- und her und weiß nicht ob ich den Daumen nach oben oder unten geben soll, das Spiel hat mich fast zur Weißglut gebracht und dennoch hat es irgendwie Spaß gemacht. 

Das erste Level ist noch relativ einfach, man muss lediglich schauen wann man außerhalb des Kreises und wann innerhalb ist, zum Ende bekommt man einige Hindernisse, denen man so ausweichen muss. Ziel des Spiels ist es immer in den nächsten Kreis zu kommen. Im zweiten Level findet man dann das erste wieder, nur die Kreise bewegen sich und ändern die Form, was allerdings auch noch relativ einfach ist. Im dritten Level bzw, der dritten Welt wirds dann schon schwer, um nicht zu sagen bockschwer... denn da komme ich zum Ende hin schon nicht weiter. Ich habe es unzählige Male versucht und irgendwann baut sich da einfach ein gewisser Frust auf. Trotzdem versucht man es immer wieder.

Bis hierhin würde ich wohl einen "klaren" Daumen nach unten geben, was ich aber gut fand an dem Spiel ist der Modus bei dem man Kreise erledigen muss, die random neu kommen. Schwer zu erklären, man sieht sie vorher nicht und muss sehr schnell reagieren. Den Modus finde ich sehr Spaßig, weil man da nicht ständig dieselbe Stelle hat an der man scheitert, sondern immer neue Herausforderungen. Das macht das Spiel dann auch für mich, der nicht so weit gekommen ist wieder spielbar. Dennoch geht mein Daumen eher nach unten als nach oben, allerdings will ich auch so fair sein und sagen das man für 1 EUR nicht viel falsch machen kann und selbst dieses Spiel sich dann wieder lohnt, zumindest dann, wenn man schmerzbefreit ist und gerne 1 Millionen Mal bei derselben Passage scheitert...

16926166.review:
Easy to pick up but hard to put down, [b]oO[/b] is a great game for your collection if you enjoy minimalistic and difficult games such as [b]Super Hexagon[/b], [b]Velocibox[/b], [b]The Collider[/b], [b]Pivvot[/b] etc. Like all of the forementioned games, it is fast paced, challenging and a fun way to kill a few minutes once in a while. Yes, it's difficult too, but it has a good learning curve and a nice variety of levels to progress through, thankfully it has a very helpful checkpoint mechanic as well.

Currently [b]oO[/b] is incredibly cheap (£0.79 in my case) so I'd definitely recommend picking it up, there are certainly worse things you could be doing with 79p. 

This game would certainly benefit from the addition of a level editor and Steam Achievements, hopefully something for the future.

39761255.review:
这个简直就是转圈圈版的I wanna啊超级虐的LOL
正如另一个评测里老哥所说，目前微信里有个小游戏玩法比较类似，不过平心而论，还是这款更有意思，下面会说理由。
游戏一共有十关，4个普通关卡，难度层层迭加，每关都比前一关多一种机关，还有四个由普通关卡衍生出来的鬼畜关卡，最后是无线模式以及无限模式的鬼畜版。顺带一提，关卡从一开始就可以随意选择，无需过关解锁。
相比微信小游戏，这个游戏的前四关类似于教学，虽然没有什么文字，却能很好的[strike] 劝退 [/strike]  [strike] 调教 [/strike] 教导玩家，顺便还能解锁成就，美滋滋。而微信小游戏只有无限模式而且玩法极其单调。
技巧与I wanna系列类似，简单的地方靠反应和意识，难的地方就多死几次掌握住节奏，因为普通关卡所有东西都是固定的，有时候觉得自己在玩音乐游戏hhh，无限模式就完全靠反应了，我应该是没法拿到最后一个过100个圈的成就了。
总的来说还是一个值得挑战一下的小游戏，嘛，祝君好运 o(*￣▽￣*)ブ
